meanings.definition: A machine or device used to squeeze or press out excess liquid from something.
meanings.sent1: My grandma still uses an old wringer to dry her clothes.
meanings.sent2: The wringer on the washing machine helps remove water from the laundry.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally got my hand stuck in the wringer, but luckily it wasn't turned on!
meanings.sent4: Life can sometimes feel like a wringer, squeezing out all the energy and joy.
meanings.sent5: The wringer clamped down on the fabric, leaving it almost dry in seconds.

meanings.definition: A difficult or demanding situation or experience.
meanings.sent1: Facing the final exam felt like going through a wringer.
meanings.sent2: After a long day at work, dealing with traffic was the last thing I needed - a real wringer!
meanings.sent3: Trying to juggle work, school, and family responsibilities can be a real wringer.
meanings.sent4: The project deadline put me through the wringer, but I managed to finish on time.
meanings.sent5: The wringer of life can sometimes bring out the best in us, even in tough times.
